description: Odd part of phi(n): a(n) = A000265(A000010(n)).
comments: This is not necessarily the squarefree kernel. E.g., for n=19, phi(19)=18 is divisible by 9, an odd square. Values at which this kernel is 1 correspond to A003401 (polygons constructible with ruler and compass).Multiplicative with a(2^e) = 1, a(p^e) = p^(e-1)*A000265(p-1). - _Christian G. Bower_, May 16 2005
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: n = 70 = 2*5*7, phi(70) = 24 = 8*3, so the odd kernel of 70 is a(70)=3.
prog: (PARI) a(n)=n=eulerphi(n);n>>valuation(n,2) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Mar 05 2013(Haskell)a053575 = a000265 . a000010  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Oct 09 2013
author: _Labos Elemer_, Jan 18 2000
